content.webTitle: Youhana hits Test best as Bangladesh crumble

fields.headline: Youhana hits Test best as Bangladesh crumble
fields.bodyText: Waqar Younis and Shoaib Akhtar sped Pakistan to victory inside three days in Chittagong yesterday to wrap up the two-Test series 2-0. The tourists' new-ball pair took four wickets each as Bangladesh were skittled for 148 for the second time in the match to lose by an innings and 169 runs. Pakistan had declared on 465 for nine after Yousuf Youhana had made his best Test score of 204 not out. The International Cricket Council is to try out random drug testing at the Under-19 World Cup, which starts today in New Zealand, to assess the viability of a worldwide scheme in the run-up to next year's main World Cup in South Africa. England's Under-19 team have their opening pool match against Nepal on Monday. The New Zealand all-rounder Chris Harris, man of the match twice in three games in the current one-day triangular series in Australia, has been allowed to return home for undisclosed "family reasons" but was intending to return to Brisbane for today's day-nighter against South Africa.
